WRITING.TITLE: Question around Grav interacting with All is Dust.
WRITING.TEXT: So the Grav profile is Str5, AP-3, D1. So against Rubricks, the all is dust rule would kick in to provide a +1 to our saves. However, Grav against anything with a 3+ save gets D3 damage. So would all is dust still kick in providing us 4+ Invuln, or does the extra rule for Grav override that?

WRITING.TITLE: Advice on 1500pt list vs Ad Mech
WRITING.TEXT: Hey everyone, Just looking for some advice and/or criticism on my 1500 point list. Ill be going against my brother who will be taking Mars Admech. Pretty sure he will have Cawl along with shooty Kastelans and lots (6?) Heavy Grav destoyers. Its either this or I reduce the Rubrics, remove the enlightened and a MVB and add in magnus, but hes like 1/3rd of the army and not sure how effective he will be. ++ Chaos - Thousand Sons - Battalion [1498pts] ++ ++ HQ [346pts] ++ - Ahriman on Disc of Tzeentch [166pts]: Glamour of Tzeentch, Prescience, Tzeentch's Firestorm - Daemon Prince of Tzeentch [180pts]: WL Trait= Otherworldly Prescience, Relic= Dark Matter Crystal, Gaze of Fate, Warptime, Wings, 2x Malefic Talons ++ Troops [609pts] ++ - Rubric Marines [226pts] . Aspiring Sorcerer: Force stave, Plasma pistol, Infernal Gaze 8x Rubric Marine w/ Inferno Boltgun 1x Rubric Marine w/ Soulreaper cannon - Rubric Marines [226pts] . Aspiring Sorcerer: Force stave, Plasma pistol, Glamour of Tzeentch 8x Rubric Marine w/ Inferno Boltgun 1x Rubric Marine w/ Soulreaper cannon - Tzaangors [157pts]: Twistbray w/ Tzaangor Blades 20x Tzaangor w/ Tzaangor Blades Brayhorn ++ Elites [90pts] ++ - Tzaangor Shaman [90pts]: Temporal Manipulation ++ Fast Attack [153pts] ++ - Tzaangor Enlightened [153pts]: Aviarch w/ Fatecaster Greatbow 8x Enlightened w/Fatecaster Greatbows ++ Heavy Support [300pts] ++ - Mutalith Vortex Beast [150pts] - Mutalith Vortex Beast [150pts]

WRITING.TITLE: 1500pt list advice vs World Eaters
WRITING.TEXT: Hey everyone, Just looking for advice and/or criticism on my list going against Khorne World Eaters. Pretty sure my opponent will have at least 1 DPoK, 2-3 10x Berserkers in Rhinos. My plan with the list is to get the fusion in turn 1 to pop vehicles / kill characters if i can get to them. The Shadowseer with suit of subtle knives will be getting into combat hopefully with some berserkers then with the Lightning Reflexes strategem and the 2 psychic powers getting mortal wounds off on a unit when they roll 1's, 2's 3's and 4's. The Deathjester with curtainfall will also be making use of stratgems to cause more hits and hopefully more mortal wounds. Please let me know what you think. ++ Battalion Detachment +5CP (Harlequins - Soaring Spite) [1183pts] ++ ++ HQ [15 PL, 297pts] ++ - Shadowseer [125pts]: Fog of Dreams, Veil of Tears, Shuriken Pistol, The Suit of Hidden Knives - Troupe Master [86pts]: Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Caress - Troupe Master [86pts]: Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Caress ++ Troops [405pts] ++ - Troupe [132pts] 1x Player w/ Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Caress 3x Players w/ Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Embrace 1x Player w/ Harlequin's Embrace, Shuriken Pistol - Troupe [132pts] 1x Player w/ Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Caress 3x Players w/ Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Embrace 1x Player w/ Harlequin's Embrace, Shuriken Pistol - Troupe [5 PL, 141pts] 1x Player w/ Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Caress 4x Players w/ Fusion Pistol, Harlequin's Embracen's Embrace [6pts] ++ Fast Attack [184pts] ++ - Skyweavers [184pts] 4x Skyweavers w/ Shuriken Cannon, Zephyrglaive + Dedicated Transport [15 PL, 297pts] ++ - Starweaver [99pts]: 2x Shuriken Cannons - Starweaver [99pts]: 2x Shuriken Cannons - Starweaver [99pts]: 2x Shuriken Cannons +++ Vanguard Detachment +1CP (Harlequins - Dreaming Shadow) [313pts] +++ ++ HQ [125pts] ++ - Shadowseer [125pts]: Mirror of Minds, Twilight Pathways, Shuriken Pistol, WL Trait: Player of Twilight ++ Elites [188pts] ++ - Death Jester [45pts]: Curtainfall - Death Jester [45pts] - Solitaire [98pts]: Harlequin's Caress, Harlequin's Kiss ++ Total: [1496pts] ++

WRITING.TITLE: Best CQC loadout to take on Obliterators/Mutilators?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey Everyone. I have a 1,500 point game this weekend against my brother playing Khorne. He often fields Obliterators and/or Mutilators and this will be the first time playing harlequins against them. I normally just go with the Embracem but I've been trying to work out what is the best melee weapon to take them on. Stats are T4, 3W, 2+,5++). The Embrace forces them to take their invuln, Caress wounds on 3's while the Kiss can obviously 1 shot them. All advice and opinions welcome!

WRITING.TITLE: Masque Choice for a Brigade?
WRITING.TEXT: So now that we can viably take a semi decent brigade (not that anyone is likely to) I was just wondering what people's Masque of Choice would be? The Standout for me would be Soaring Spite or Frozen Stars. I can also see a case being made for Silent Shroud. What is everyones opinion?

WRITING.TITLE: Hellforged Sicaran Kitbash/Conversion?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all. Couple of questions? First off has anyone used a Hellforged Sicaran in any of their games and if so how did it do? Next us is has anyone converted / Kitbashed one of these. I love the forgeworld model but hate the price tag and resin. What would people suggest i use to do this?

WRITING.TITLE: Double Battalion Deathwatch, C amp;C welcome
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all, So I love the fluff behind Deathwatch and love the way the models look, but I don't actually play them. I'm getting bored of playing my Crimson Fists and im thinking of proxying them for some Deathwatch in a game or 2. I got the majority of this build from Josh @ MWG and im just wondering if it will work for friendly-semi competitive games. By that I mean something i can just stick down on the table against more or less any faction but still have a good chance at winning. **++ Unbound Army (Faction) (Imperium - Deathwatch) [53 PL, 987pts] ++** **+ HQ +** **Watch Captain [7 PL, 130pts]:** Bolt Pistol, Jump Pack, Storm shield, The Beacon Angelis, Thunder hammer **Watch Master [7 PL, 130pts]:** Lord of Hidden Knowledge, Warlord **+ Troops +** **Intercessors [5 PL, 101pts]:** Auxiliary Grenade Launcher . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor Sergeant:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle **Intercessors [5 PL, 101pts]:** Auxiliary Grenade Launcher . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle . **Intercessor Sergeant:** Bolt Pistol, Bolt rifle **Veterans [17 PL, 268pts]** . **Black Shield:** Power sword, Storm shield . **Vanguard Veteran:** Lightning Claw (Pair) . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Watch Sergeant:** Plasma pistol, Xenophase Blade **+ Flyer +** **Corvus Blackstar [12 PL, 257pts]:** Auspex Array, Hurricane bolter, Twin lascannon . **2x Stormstrike Missile Launchers:** 2x Stormstrike missile launcher **++ Unbound Army (Faction) (Imperium - Deathwatch) [65 PL, 1012pts] ++** **+ HQ +** **Watch Captain [5 PL, 84pts]:** Bolt Pistol, Master-crafted Boltgun, Power sword **Watch Captain [5 PL, 84pts]:** Bolt Pistol, Master-crafted Boltgun, Power sword **+ Troops +** **Veterans [9 PL, 100pts]** . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun **Veterans [19 PL, 239pts]** . **Biker:** Twin boltgun . **Biker:** Twin boltgun . **Biker:** Twin boltgun . **Biker:** Twin boltgun . **Vanguard Veteran:** Bolt Pistol, Power sword . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun **Veterans [15 PL, 248pts]** . **Black Shield:** Power sword, Storm shield . **Vanguard Veteran:** Lightning Claw (Pair) . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Watch Sergeant:** Plasma pistol, Xenophase Blade **+ Flyer +** **Corvus Blackstar [12 PL, 257pts]:** Auspex Array, Hurricane bolter, Twin lascannon . **2x Stormstrike Missile Launchers:** 2x Stormstrike missile launcher **++ Total: [118 PL, 1999pts] ++** The idea is to start the 2 frag cannon vet squads in the Corvus with the Watch Master joining the 8 man squad. The stalker vets are there to camp backfield objectives and the primaris to hold midfield. I will also combat squad the 1 stalker vet squad into 4 bikes + vanguard. These are my objective grabbers if i need to get somewhere quick. The master crafted boltgun captains stick towards the back. Im not a huge fan of mixed primaris squads but everything else is fair game. Any advice?

WRITING.TITLE: Process for Collecting?
WRITING.TEXT: To all you experienced hobbyists out there.... We all love "plastic crack" and so often i find myself building armies very ad hoc with units that i like the look of or want to try on the table. Out of maybe 5-6 armies i collect only space marines and my Admech are at a point where i can happily change up my 2000 pt lists and them not be samey. So when you guys (and gals) decide to collect a new army do you have a process you go through to purchase the models? Do you sit down and right out what your going to buy in what order - eg. Hq and troops first, then this unit and that unit. Is it governed by the games you play with what you have and what you feel you need. Or do you just splurge on the whole list and build from there. I ask as it would be great if I could get some of my armies to a playable point without getting distracted by my addiction

WRITING.TITLE: New to DW and looking for advice on Troops
WRITING.TEXT: So I'm getting bored of my Crimson Fists and have always loved the look and fluff of the Deathwatch. I'm pretty sure I will be building out a 2,000 point force soon (probably double battalion with 2x Corvus) but for the time being im going to proxy and get to grips with them I'm not a fan of the idea of mixed primaris squads but love the intercessor models so will probably go with 2 min sized squads, along with 2x 5 man stalker squads of vets. I'm really looking for advice on loadout for 10man vet squads, at the moment im thinking of running them like so: - Watch Sergeant w/ Stormbolter + Powersword - Black Shield w/ Powersword + Stormshield - 3x Vets w/ Fragcannon - 4x Vets w/ Chainsword + Stormbolter - Vanguard Vet w/ Lightning claws What do we think, is this a good loadout or are 3 fragcannons to much?

WRITING.TITLE: First 1,000pts for Deathwatch. Advise please?
WRITING.TEXT: So been playing around with some Deathwatch lists and realise I never do a small list to start an army. So here is a 1k list for Deathwatch. Not super competitive but want to win some friendly games. What do you think? **++ Unbound Army (Faction) (Imperium - Deathwatch) [63 PL, 998pts] ++** **+ HQ +** **Watch Captain [7 PL, 121pts]:** Bolt Pistol, Jump Pack, Power fist, Storm shield (Index), The Beacon Angelis **Watch Master [7 PL, 130pts]:** Lord of Hidden Knowledge, Warlord **+ Troops +** **Veterans [9 PL, 100pts]** . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Watch Sergeant:** Stalker Pattern Boltgun **Veterans [9 PL, 100pts]** . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Stalker Pattern Boltgun . **Watch Sergeant:** Stalker Pattern Boltgun **Veterans [19 PL, 290pts]** . **Black Shield:** Power sword, Storm Bolter . **Vanguard Veteran:** Lightning Claw (Pair) . **Veteran:** Storm Bolter, Storm shield . **Veteran:** Power sword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran:** Chainsword, Storm Bolter . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Veteran w/ Heavy Weapon:** Deathwatch Frag Cannon . **Watch Sergeant:** Power sword, Storm Bolter **+ Flyer +** **Corvus Blackstar [12 PL, 257pts]:** Auspex Array, Hurricane bolter, Twin lascannon . **2x Stormstrike Missile Launchers:** 2x Stormstrike missile launcher **++ Total: [63 PL, 998pts] ++**

WRITING.TITLE: How much does GW's Varnish spray cover?
WRITING.TEXT: As the title says. I've never really varnished my models before but have gotten to the point in my skill where I care more for them. Considering I want to go back and varnish all my 40k models (around 5 armies worth each around 2,000pts) how much does a can of GW's Varnish cover? It can be found herehttps://www.games-workshop.com/en-GB/Citadel-Purity-Seal-2017

WRITING.TITLE: Question: How do you model Stalker Pattern Boltguns?
WRITING.TEXT: As the title says, I'm looking to have 2 squads of 5 stalker pattern boltgun vets sit in my back lines and take pop shots, but you only get 1 stalker boltgun per 5 guys in the GW kit. Im thinking of picking some stuff up from anvilindustry and thinking about these http://anvilindustry.co.uk/The-Armoury/Rifles-Shotguns-Pistols/Exorcist-Rifle. Was tempted by the longer rifles but think they would be TOO big. http://anvilindustry.co.uk/The-Armoury/Rifles-Shotguns-Pistols/M88-%22Negotiator%22 What do you guys use / kitbash with?

WRITING.TITLE: Typical numbers of 'support' in a Watch Fortress?
WRITING.TEXT: So after picking up my codex and having a read through, it gives a pretty good picture of how a Watch Fortress is composed in regards to Veterans / Captains. How about the other options. Talasa Prime has 3 Librarians and Chaplains, with 2 Venerable Dreadnoughts. Would this be typical Does any one have an idea of the number of Apothecaries, Librarians, Chaplains and Dreadnoughts a Watch Fortress would hold?

WRITING.TITLE: Suggestions for basing Deathwatch?
WRITING.TEXT: As the title. Really not sure how to base my Deathwatch. So far I have 5 done with astrogranite to look urban but really not sure on them. I #8217;ve got crimson fists on desert bases but looking for something a bit different? Please reply with suggestions and photos too if you like

WRITING.TITLE: Leviathan Dreadnought conversion questions
WRITING.TEXT: So from what I've seen all over the net Leviathan's are amazing and do very good work in a deathwatch list. My issue is I'm not a massive fan of spending that much money and not a fan of how they look, so have been contemplating kitbashing a Nemesis Dreadknight with a Redemptor and turn it into a Leviathan. The writing on the nemesis strikes me as very deathwatch and I love the main body of a redemptor. - Do you think this could work, like would it be the right height / scale? - How would you model 2x Stormcannon arrays? I was thinking of using some of the autocannon bits from anvil industries: http://anvilindustry.co.uk/Regiments/regiments-heavy-support-weapons/regiments-autocannon-heavy-support-weapon

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for Dreadnought Lascannon and ML arms.
WRITING.TEXT: As the title says really. I picked up 2 really cheap dreadnoughts that came with plasma cannons and fist arms, but want to run them as Twin Las and ML. Looking on the bits sites for ages, but those arms are always sold out. Any one know where i could pick some up or if other companies do something that would work? I know FW sell the Lascannon but I dont like working with resin and there expensive

WRITING.TITLE: Deathwatch for KT
WRITING.TEXT: Having a play around I came up with a 5 and a 6 man team would love feedback on what you think and also respond with what loadouts you are thinking: 5 Man Kill Team: - Intercessor Sergeant w/ Bolt Rifle, Bolt Pistol, Power Sword - Black shield w/ Power Sword, Storm Shield - Veteran Gunner w/ Frag Cannon - Veteran w/ Boltguns, Power Swords - Veteran w/ Combi-Plasma, Power Sword 100 Points, could swap some stuff around for the Infernus HB, or potentially another Fragcannon 6 Man Kill Team: - Veteran Sergeant w/ Boltgun, Power Sword - Black Shield w/ Boltgun, Power Sword - 4x Veterans w/ Boltgun, Power Sword Again bang on 100 points What do you guys think would be the stronger team?

WRITING.TITLE: KT Points for ALL Factions
KT Points for ALL Factions

WRITING.TEXT: I think you nailed it! Plasma was my first thought. May steal this for the next army I do #128516;
Yes that #8217;s what the dry paints are like some are drier than others
mechanics standard grey/dark reaper at a guess
As a first time that is amazing. Only tip I would give is perhaps using Bloodletter to blend the colour changes together

I don #8217;t think it will help the blend but because of the gloss you won #8217;t notice as much. For future add the white dot after the glaze if you want that stark glint. Otherwise I find it doesn #8217;t deter too much from it as long as you don #8217;t go to heavy on the glaze
This is pretty much what I was going to go for! Decided not to do armies on parade this year due to lack of funds for a board
Are the marines painted in the same scheme? The right seems darker. I think I prefer the tan but I would go a tone or 2 darker on the base
Holy hell in a hand basket! That looks phenomanal
Would love to know what all the scenery is and how you made it #128512;
Well done mike! Kara says congrats!
Apart from the valkyries and maybe command squads you don #8217;t have envy real anti tank. Is the plan to chew through armour with weight of fire?
Base looks awesome too. Would love to know how you built it
Couldn #8217;t agree more, every one has a rule or faction they hate more than others. For me it #8217;s necrons with reanimation protocols and quantum shielding
Work from celestra grey up to ulthuan grey and then highlight white scar. If it #8217;s large enough area dry brushing ulthuan and white scar works best I found
The painting is fantastic, however for me the blue could be darker and I think you need some crimson highlights in there, as at the moment it could just be ultramarines

I understand wanting to use D amp;D system, for me it #8217;s a much more enjoyable system. Don #8217;t get me wrong I enjoy dark heresy / only war / rogue trader but it seems D amp;D is more customisable to the exact nature of character and campaign. That being said I think it #8217;s really easy to stick 40k to D amp;D system. In 5th (think in the DM manual) there is a section for futuristic campaigns. For example terminator armour could be full plate, power armour could be breastplate etc. Use the system but just change the names of spells / skills / gear etc
Really well done, looks good. Maybe go a bit brighter on the extreme highs, don #8217;t be afraid to do a standard highlight on top of a wet blend to make it pop

This is awesome. The colour scheme works so well, with the red standing out but not overpowering the whole model. What colour did you use for the gold? Can #8217;t tell if it #8217;s retributor or Balthasar
Still a fantastic job and the red will really help. Also who doesn #8217;t like hazard stripes #128541;
Seriously? Lamenters have grown over the years...lol
They are useful but by no means cripple those armies. They are defined by the number of CP we have. At the end of the day we are still power armour guys

WRITING.TITLE: Experienced 40k player, new to GK. Advise?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all! So I #8217;m looking to get into Grey Knights and will run them solo. Although they will be part of a much larger complete Ordo collection I #8217;m planning. Now I know GK are not in a good place but still love the fluff and models. I am looking for advise on any must have compositions when it comes to the army and advise on the 2 lists I had ideas for. The 1st being a standard TAC and the 2nd as a mortal wound gimmick. Also not to sure what powers to give what. LIST 1 #160; **++ Unbound Army (Faction) (Imperium - Grey Knights) [110 PL, 2000pts] ++** #160; **+ HQ +** #160; **Grand Master in Nemesis Dreadknight [14 PL, 290pts]:** 4: First to the Fray, Dreadfist, Gatling Psilencer, Heavy Incinerator, Nemesis Daemon Greathammer, Sanctuary, Warlord #160; **Grand Master Voldus [10 PL, 190pts]:** Gate of Infinity, Hammerhand, Vortex of Doom #160; **Lord Kaldor Draigo [12 PL, 240pts]:** Hammerhand, Sanctuary #160; **+ Troops +** #160; **Strike Squad [7 PL, 105pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **4x Grey Knight (Falchions):** 4x Storm Bolter . **Grey Knight Justicar:** Storm bolter, Two Nemesis Falchions #160; **Strike Squad [7 PL, 105pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **4x Grey Knight (Falchions):** 4x Storm Bolter . **Grey Knight Justicar:** Storm bolter, Two Nemesis Falchions #160; **Strike Squad [14 PL, 210pts]:** Hammerhand . **9x Grey Knight (Falchions):** 9x Storm Bolter . **Grey Knight Justicar:** Storm bolter, Two Nemesis Falchions #160; **+ Elites +** #160; **Apothecary [5 PL, 90pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected *, Nemesis Falchion #160; **Brotherhood Ancient [7 PL, 130pts]:** Curiass of Sacrifice, Gate of Infinity, Nemesis Falchion, Storm bolter #160; **Paladin Squad [19 PL, 288pts]:** Sanctuary . **4x Paladin (Halberd):** 4x Storm Bolter . **Paragon:** Nemesis Daemon Hammer, Storm Bolter #160; **+ Flyer +** #160; **Stormraven Gunship [15 PL, 352pts]:** 2x Stormstrike Missile Launcher, Twin Assault Cannon, Twin multi-melta, Two Hurricane Bolters #160; **++ Total: [110 PL, 2000pts] ++** #160; LIST 2 #160; **++ Unbound Army (Faction) (Imperium - Grey Knights) [111 PL, 1994pts] ++** #160; **+ HQ +** #160; **Brother-Captain [9 PL, 152pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected *, Nemesis Force Halberd, Storm Bolter #160; **Grand Master in Nemesis Dreadknight [14 PL, 290pts]:** Dreadfist, Dreadknight teleporter, Gatling Psilencer, Heavy Psycannon, Nemesis Daemon Greathammer, Sanctuary #160; **Grand Master in Nemesis Dreadknight [14 PL, 290pts]:** Dreadfist, Gatling Psilencer, Heavy Incinerator, Nemesis Daemon Greathammer, Sanctuary #160; **Grand Master Voldus [10 PL, 190pts]:** Gate of Infinity, Hammerhand, Vortex of Doom #160; **+ Troops +** #160; **Strike Squad [7 PL, 105pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **4x Grey Knight (Falchions):** 4x Storm Bolter . **Grey Knight Justicar:** Storm bolter, Two Nemesis Falchions #160; **Strike Squad [7 PL, 105pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **4x Grey Knight (Falchions):** 4x Storm Bolter . **Grey Knight Justicar:** Storm bolter, Two Nemesis Falchions #160; **Strike Squad [7 PL, 105pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **4x Grey Knight (Falchions):** 4x Storm Bolter . **Grey Knight Justicar:** Storm bolter, Two Nemesis Falchions #160; **+ Elites +** #160; **Purifier Squad [9 PL, 140pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **Knight of the Flame:** Nemesis Force Sword, Storm Bolter . **4x Purifier (Falchion):** 4x Storm Bolter #160; **Purifier Squad [9 PL, 140pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **Knight of the Flame:** Nemesis Force Sword, Storm Bolter . **4x Purifier (Falchion):** 4x Storm Bolter #160; **Purifier Squad [9 PL, 140pts]:** * No Psychic Power Selected * . **Knight of the Flame:** Nemesis Force Sword, Storm Bolter . **4x Purifier (Falchion):** 4x Storm Bolter #160; **+ Heavy Support +** #160; Agree with this. On tabletop you may not notice the difference but the newer one is a much cleaner job. #128522;
Is that a dark Eldar head? Looks a tad small on the Primaris body
You #8217;ve really done. Good job here look exactly like the skins on the salamander in deathwatch cassius
I had this happen in one of my games a few weeks back and my dice aren #8217;t rounded. When we bumped he table it just stayed there and still for the life of me can #8217;t work how what happened

I #8217;m in a similiar spot. Grabbed GSC in 7th and a bunch on Nids in 8th and just fell out of love. I think for me it #8217;s because there a horde army and I just can #8217;t afford to have the army I want. That and I #8217;m particular about painting and doing 100 or so gribblies to a good standard is a pain
I found that. I tried keeping them in a GW case but the genestealers just don #8217;t sit right and then as you said all the nidzillas. I #8217;ve just stuck all my gribblies in a cardboard box
I put my genestealers on 32mm bases as it just felt right, actually makes them more stable than 25mm so no breaking still a pain tho
Yeah they tore the foam up something fierce

WRITING.TITLE: Experienced 40k player, new to GK. Advise?

WRITING.TEXT: More specifically that is a Phantom

I #8217;m glad I #8217;m not the only one thinking this. The sheer amount of AOS does irritate me. But the golden demon articles are grey if your looking to improve painting and they have some good army articles from the community every now and then

For the second list I took out a purifier squad for an ancient with the relic banner. The idea of the big land raider was the purifiers, Voldus, brother captain and ancient go in and then turn 2 pop out to do 3d6 mortal wounds and vortex
Best thing to do would be to ask them, but I don #8217;t think anyone would have a problem if they were painted up deathwatch with silver arm and chapter shoulder pad
Where ms the head from?
That white looks so clean! How did you manage that. Would love to know your recipe
Hmmm. I don #8217;t remember that one. I #8217;ll have to dig it out my bits then
Really crisp and clean job. Love it!
Pretty sure the hive mind stops them from realising the kinda s**t there really in

WRITING.TITLE: Are Orks going to be TOO good?
WRITING.TEXT: First off the rules Warhammer Community have been #8216;leaking #8217; for the Orks look amazing. I really feel they are capturing the individual Kulturs really well. What I #8217;m seeing makes me very happy for the ork players out there and I #8217;m getting tempted to pick some up myself. However is it me or are the rules a bit too powerful. They seem to me that orks will be really powerful with their codex. Do we think these are too much or that they will be OP?
This army scratches an itch I never knew I had. These are Amazing! Where did you get the idea for them?
Send them back to GW and request that they reimburse you for saving the planet
I #8217;m pretty sure no GW store would hugely care about those bases.
Good ole #8217; regular clean of paint slag. The amount I have destroyed my fingers trying to get that crap out is staggering

1st of the models in Blackstone Fortress aren #8217;t cultists there renegades (not much difference). Also the current cultists are just too monopose and if you want to kit them out a different way then you have to convert
Looking very good. Hit the recesses with nuln oil and a quick highlight will really make it pop

Personally for me I think the OSL is a little over the top. I wouldn #8217;t have the light going that far. Also I #8217;ve always seen the little panels on the turrets more as screens than lights so wouldn #8217;t give off that much. The rest of there paint job is great though!

If you click on narrative campaigns go to the oldest and watch through to the newest. Most of their campaigns are about different things and the Sentinels of the Forge (their own chapter) only appear occasionally. However they often have characters from one campaign pop up in others. For eg the leader of the tyrus incident occurs as a black shield in their most recent deathwatch campaign

WRITING.TITLE: Bad Moons Battalion
WRITING.TEXT: So looking for some C amp;C on this bad moons list. The list is a mix of units I think look cool like the new buggies and units I think could do well. By no means competitive but want to make sure it won #8217;t suck either #160; **++ Unbound Army (Faction) (Orks) [110 PL, 1999pts] ++** #160; **+ No Force Org Slot +** #160; **Clan Kultur:** Bad Moons #160; **+ HQ +** #160; **Big Mek (Index) [5 PL, 88pts]:** Grot Oiler, Kustom Force Field, Kustom Mega-blasta #160; **Warboss [4 PL, 80pts]:** Attack Squig, Da Best Armour Teef Can Buy, Da Killa Klaw, Kustom Shoota, Power Klaw, Warlord #160; **Weirdboy [3 PL, 62pts]:** 2. Warpath, 3. Da Jump, Warphead (1 CP) #160; **+ Troops +** #160; **Boyz [7 PL, 157pts]:** 2x Tankbusta Bombs . **Boss Nob:** Big Choppa, Kustom Shoota (Index) . **Ork Boy W/ 'Eavy Weapon:** Big Shoota . **Ork Boy W/ 'Eavy Weapon:** Big Shoota . **17x Ork Boy W/ Shoota** #160; **Boyz [11 PL, 154pts]:** 2x Tankbusta Bombs . **Boss Nob:** Big Choppa, Kustom Shoota (Index) . **20x Ork Boy W/ Slugga amp; Choppa** #160; **Boyz [7 PL, 157pts]:** 2x Tankbusta Bombs . **Boss Nob:** Big Choppa, Kustom Shoota (Index) . **Ork Boy W/ 'Eavy Weapon:** Big Shoota . **Ork Boy W/ 'Eavy Weapon:** Big Shoota . **17x Ork Boy W/ Shoota** #160; **Gretchin [1 PL, 30pts]:** 10x Gretchin #160; **Gretchin [1 PL, 30pts]:** 10x Gretchin #160; **Gretchin [1 PL, 30pts]:** 10x Gretchin #160; **+ Elites +** #160; **Meganobz [10 PL, 175pts]** . **Boss Meganob w/ PK:** Kustom Shoota, Power Klaw . **Meganob W/ PK:** Kustom Shoota, Power Klaw . **Meganob W/ PK:** Kustom Shoota, Power Klaw . **Meganob W/ PK:** Kustom Shoota, Power Klaw . **Meganob W/ PK:** Kustom Shoota, Power Klaw #160; **Nob with Waaagh! Banner [4 PL, 77pts]:** Kustom Shoota #160; **Tankbustas [8 PL, 190pts]:** 2x Bomb Squig . **Boss Nob:** Rokkit Launcha . **9x Tankbusta:** 9x Rokkit Launcha #160; **+ Fast Attack +** #160; **Megatrukk Scrapjet [10 PL, 110pts]** . **Megatrukk Scrapjet:** 2x Twin Big Shoota #160; **Megatrukk Scrapjet [10 PL, 110pts]** . **Megatrukk Scrapjet:** 2x Twin Big Shoota #160; **Shokkjump Dragstas [6 PL, 120pts]** . **Shokkjump Dragstas:** Rokkit Launcha #160; **+ Heavy Support +** #160; **Battlewagon [8 PL, 155pts]:** 4x Big Shoota, Killkannon #160; **Mek Gunz [2 PL, 31pts]** . **Gun:** Smasha Gun #160; **Mek Gunz [2 PL, 31pts]** . **Gun:** Smasha Gun #160; **+ Flyer +** #160; **Dakkajet [7 PL, 148pts]:** 6x Supa Shoota #160; **+ Dedicated Transport +** #160; **Trukk [3 PL, 64pts]:** Big Shoota #160; **++ Total: [110 PL, 1999pts] ++**

I prefer the Killkannon on the Mek Guns, but really couldn #8217;t find the points which is why I went with the Smasha guns. Fairly cheap but efficient way to fill out the heavy slots. Because they have the Gretchin keyword they won #8217;t be refilling ones but that #8217;s not to bad, as you said bs4 goes a long way to help. The only thing I #8217;m not too sure on is the Meganobz. The 4 inch move really bugs me and there not cheap, but they have a better save and an extra wound over the nobs
This is awesome. The detail is great, wish I could get my freehand to that level

Did you follow the WHTV tutorial and use nilakh oxide? On there tutorial it didn #8217;t seem like they got good coverage but this looks good, tad on the chalky side. When I come to do mine I think I #8217;ll make up a pale blue instead of the nilakh
That back is simply beautiful. Are they going to raven guard?
Nice! Be great to see it based and another hand lol
Could go super cheap for bolt pistol, chainsword. Dual pistols looks awesome and works well if deepstriking. My personal choice is dual lightning claws for a bit of punch in CC which I often see

I would keep the terminators cheap with just stormbolters and powerswords. In my opinion the assault cannon is a trap. Yes you get 6 shots but you #8217;ll be at a -1 to hit when moving and a storm Bolter gets SIA, so either wound on 2+ or get AP-1. I normally wouldn #8217;t go for 2 termies either as they are very expensive. You could get another 2 vets for there cost

You can but only back in to your deployment zone where you have to place the teleport homer. I think the best use of them is to tank shots or to auto pass morale. Terminators are good, it #8217;s just I feel there a bit too expensive at the moment. But it #8217;s all down to personal choice. I think some DW tournament players place high while using them so it #8217;s not like hey can #8217;t be effective

I think I prefer the right one. The white helmet and Aquila break the model up a bit. Otherwise it #8217;s just black

Beautiful work. Really crisp and clean. Love the power spear
Already pledged #128518;

WRITING.TITLE: Warboss base size. 60mm too big?
WRITING.TEXT: Just a quick question. Looking to get into orks as I #8217;m loving the new buggies and kulturs, and I #8217;ve had a AOS Warboss for a while, which is on a 60mm base. Is this too big to play as a 40k Warboss? I #8217;ve seen some massive Warbosses around and just wondering what #8217;s the limit

Do it! That would look awesome. Fluff wise there isn #8217;t much the deathwatch won #8217;t use, even if they hate using it. Stick a necromancy head on the base and the fluff can be they are in a campaign fighting the crowns and he got the shield then
I could probably get him on a 50mm, think 40mm will be a push. Is there really any issue with slightly larger base?

Most DW players pick up the Corvus pretty quick. One thing I always want but pass up for better units is the landraider. If someone got me one I would be stoked. Think it would be awesome to do in DW colours

As everyone has said any traitor marines would be black shields. But the idea of painting the poldron in the traitors scheme and then scratch it up, enough that it looks like it #8217;s been scratched off but leave some of the colour remaining
